Comment: Rurera has helped tremendously to be a great learner because it helps me practice and learn new things. I have tried the Diagnostic and I think it's great! It really helps you to see which things you should work on and where you're at so you don't do really easy or really hard things.

As a parent, I love your site, Rurera, and what you offer! My son really loved your graphics, and he liked the lessons! Our son has been doing math skills this summer, and it's a great refresher before school starts. Thank you for having Rurera readily available!

I homeschool three girls and have been using Rurera for a while now. I love that I can do the diagnostics for each child, and that it is very easy for them to complete state objectives. My girls are no longer afraid to get the answer wrong. They know that as long as they answer, there will be an explanation for incorrect answers.
It's easy for my kids to use Rurera, and it helps me see where their learning is aligning with state standards. It's a very powerful tool and one of the best educational apps we've ever used.

Halfway through the school year, we could tell our daughter wasn't mastering the math skills she needed. After just three weeks, her comprehension and confidence are definitely growing. I would recommend Rurera to any parent who is concerned about their child's progress.

This program, Rurera, takes the frustration out of math because it allows the student to practice at his/her own pace and stay focused. It's okay if you mark one wrong because another one will be waiting. This is a great tool to have.
I love how Rurera is tailored to EXACTLY where my children are academically.

Rurera helps my son and our foster child by identifying where they need to focus to have a well-rounded knowledge base. My favorite part is the Diagnostic; I like being able to assess and reassess my child's abilities and points of weakness.

I let my son choose whatever he wants to practice on Rurera. The positive reinforcement and reports are great... My son does not mind doing lessons. This is an unconventional usage, but absolutely works for us. I recommend it for other parents with special needs children.

I love that my child has the opportunity to review concepts and advance to the next stages when mastery is achieved. My son has come in 2nd in his school because of practicing math in Rurera.
Getting to the basics and working up from there in small steps and not leaps — I find Rurera supports this very well. I saw a vast improvement in my older child's fraction answering.

As a parent, I love Rurera. My son thinks it is another computer game. He loves the game board, with the stars and awards. What an incentive for the kids to look forward to! My preschooler is so excited to fill in all the award spots. It is just awesome.

I get kids of all ages, but the one thing they have in common is a lack of parental interest in their education. Rurera has helped them build skills and gain confidence in a way they never have before. It really helps turn them around. It takes the hardest subject and helps them excel.

has had a positive impact on his grade. His overall attitude towards math has also improved, and he no longer is discouraged at his ability to understand and solve the problems in class.
